channel.title: What do you prefer?
channel.description:
do you prefer linux or windows? and why.
me prefer windows for gamming, and linux for server running.

item.title: What do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

i prefer linux as an operating system but its just too incompatible with so many things i would rather just run windows and deal with the errors as they come

Read full topic

item.title: What do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @Scarecrows Scarecrows
item.description:
@Scarecrows wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:12, topic:280909”]If you have not tried Linux try it in a Virtual Machine like Microsoft Virtual PC or Virtual Box.

The only reason Windows is used by everyone because they have the money and alliances with 3rd party developers. More importantly the pc games industry only make “Games for Windows” becuase they are given a huge lump of money in the first place. The main problem with Windows OS’s is that everything is covered up with something and that is covered up with something else. This means customation and alteration becomes very tricky however Linux is open to any form of modification.
Linux is a much nicer OS to work with. You can choose between GNOME, KDE, Xfce instead of being forced with Windows Aero. Linux also doesnt eat half of your CPU or RAM or piss you off with UAC (The most annoying thing known to man) instead theres a lovely command called “su” which you only have to type once. With the creation of Wine a lot of Windows only programs can run in Linux so compatibility is now less of a problem, on the other hand not all applications work in Wine.
In Conclusion Linux > Windows.[/quote]
This.

Read full topic

item.title: What do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

fellixombc:

Linux, IF your not talking about creating websites.

What does website development have to do with it? I find linux has far better remote access and ide-type software for web coding.

I mostly use XP - I’ve never tried Vista and probably never will unless someone gives me a free disc or something. Linux is great but only use it when XP lacks a function I can only do on Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: What do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you have not tried Linux try it in a Virtual Machine like Microsoft Virtual PC or Virtual Box.

The only reason Windows is used by everyone because they have the money and alliances with 3rd party developers. More importantly the pc games industry only make “Games for Windows” becuase they are given a huge lump of money in the first place. The main problem with Windows OS’s is that everything is covered up with something and that is covered up with something else. This means customation and alteration becomes very tricky however Linux is open to any form of modification.
Linux is a much nicer OS to work with. You can choose between GNOME, KDE, Xfce instead of being forced with Windows Aero. Linux also doesnt eat half of your CPU or RAM or piss you off with UAC (The most annoying thing known to man) instead theres a lovely command called “su” which you only have to type once. With the creation of Wine a lot of Windows only programs can run in Linux so compatibility is now less of a problem, on the other hand not all applications work in Wine.
In Conclusion Linux > Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: What do you prefer?
item.dc:creator: @Zillionair1 Zillionair1
item.description:
@Zillionair1 wrote:

Linux. Because it is faster and more stable then Windows.

[quote=“killerblues, post:9, topic:280909”]Windows it is better for every thing![/quote]Not everything, Windows Noob. It was everything + more that it was promised to be.

[quote=“vincentpet6, post:7, topic:280909”]Windows is more organized[/quote]It is not any more organized then Linux.

[quote=“Zoft, post:2, topic:280909”]I prefer Windows for everything because it is neat and organized.[/quote]Linux and Macs are also, your just not used to how they are organized.
